docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile--"Foreign capital saps our economy and simultaneously takes it over, allies itself closely with national monopolies and lays down the foundations for an even greater future domination," according to the first economic plan presented...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile--"Foreign capital saps our economy and simultaneously takes it over, allies itself closely with national monopolies and lays down the foundations for an even greater future domination," according to the first economic plan presented by the new Government in Chile.

headline.main: Latins of Left and Right Assail U.S.; National Aspirations See Enemy Up North

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 United States intelligence specialists are disturbed by what they regard as a steady increase in the number and quality of Soviet agents in Latin America.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 6 United States intelligence specialists are disturbed by what they regard as a steady increase in the number and quality of Soviet agents in Latin America.
docs.abstract: Article on apparent rise in number and quality of USSR intelligence agents in Latin Amer; US intelligence specialists believe USSR aims at diminishing or replacing US influence by capitalizing on Latin-Amer discontent over US trade and foreign policies; campaign reptdly conducted by 'new breed' of agents, described as personable, cosmopolitan and fluent in Spanish and often in English; 2/3 of force reptdly work for KGB, Soviet intelligence agency, and rest for GRU, Soviet army intelligence; rise in intelligence activities seen paralleling steady increase in USSR-Latin-Amer ties; USSR has opened 8 new embassies in hemisphere since World War II, plans more; reptdly seeks adherents among Latin-Amer diplomats in Moscow and tries to build orgn of young Latin leftists to serve as Soviet advocates; activities, pieced together from testimony of defectors and US intelligence, described; USSR seen quietly backing both rural and urban revolutionary movements, depending on time and place; main base for all activities is Cuba, where about 2,500 Latin Amers reptdly were trained in pol subversion between '61 and '69

headline.main: Soviet Intelligence Role In Latin America Rises; Soviet Activity Among Latins Is Growing

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WELLES Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: With the death in custody of the leader of the National Liberation Alliance last month, Brazilian authorities wrote off that terrorist group and said they expected no more political kidnappings. Now the supposedly moribund Alliance has struck anew...
docs.lead_paragraph: With the death in custody of the leader of the National Liberation Alliance last month, Brazilian authorities wrote off that terrorist group and said they expected no more political kidnappings. Now the supposedly moribund Alliance has struck anew and the Swiss Ambassador to Brazil has become the fifteenth political kidnap victim in the Western Hemisphere in fifteen months.
docs.abstract: ed on Bucher incident contends pot kidnapping is internatl disease that will spread so long as it achieves its goals; urges internatl conv, as suggested by Amer diplomats, requiring govts to refuse ransom and avoid pressuring other govts to take unusual steps for victims return

docs.snippet: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 4 An Indian who died nearly two centuries ago has emerged as one of the leading folk heroes of Latin America's revolutionary leftists, moving ahead of even such revolutionaries as the late Ernesto Che Guevara and the late Colombian...
docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, Dec. 4 An Indian who died nearly two centuries ago has emerged as one of the leading folk heroes of Latin America's revolutionary leftists, moving ahead of even such revolutionaries as the late Ernesto Che Guevara and the late Colombian priest Camilo Torres.
docs.abstract: Incas leader Tupac Amaru II, who led 18th century revolt against Spanish, has emerged as one of the leading folk heroes of Latin Amer revolutionary leftists; other exploits recalled

headline.main: Inca Who Led 1780 Revolt Now a Latin Folk Hero

docs.snippet: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 23  Churchgoing among Roman Catholics continued to decline in 1970, with 60 per cent of adults of this faith attending church in a typical week compared to 63 per cent last year and 71 per cent in 1964, the Gallup Poll reported...
docs.lead_paragraph: PRINCETON, N.J., Dec. 23 Churchgoing among Roman Catholics continued to decline in 1970, with 60 per cent of adults of this faith attending church in a typical week compared to 63 per cent last year and 71 per cent in 1964, the Gallup Poll reported today.
docs.abstract: Gallup Poll finds ch attendance among Prots, '70, at 38%, virtually same as in '69, but finds drop in attendance among Roman Caths to 60%; other data; tables

headline.main: Gallup Survey Finds a Decline In Roman Catholic Churchgoing
